basics.name: Bethany Salazar
basics.label: Frontend Developer
basics.summary: I am currently working for Jivasoft as a Frontend Developer. I completed my B.S. in Computer Science with concentrations in Software Engineering, Cloud Computing and Data Science in the University of Texas at San Antonio.

education.institution: University of Texas, San Antonio, TX

highlights: Create dynamic, functional and reusable components
Phasing in new development using React.js and create foundational code structures.
Internship for 3 summers. Learned basics of python, Django, Java, Excel, Android Studio.
Worked on a program to accurately identify animals using machine learning in C and IoT.
Tested different CPU configurations with windows apps to check performance on different number of cores. Used benchmarks, parallel programming, and Intel Software store to check diagnostics.

work.summary: Family run business that sells Mexican goods for parties, weddings and quinceneras.

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: Hackers Choice - EURODITE
awards.summary: Won Hackers Choice. Created a functional App called Erudite that keeps track of schoolwork making getting your work done rewarding and motivating treating it as a game.
